TopicTitle: After Staging, Struts Persist as Free-Floating, Permanent Debris named "DefaultName-<x>"

Articles.Content:
• KSP Version : 0.10
  • Operating System and version: Windows 11
  • CPU and GPU models: AMD Ryzen 9 3900XT |  nVidia Geforce RTX 3090 Founders
  • Description of the bug:  When using struts to stabilise  a rocket across two stages, when one stages the rocket and the struts release, they release from both sides. Instead of remaining attached to one side of the connection, they become free floating, permanent debris called "DefaultName-<X>" that must each be deleted manually from the tracking station.  
  • Expectation: Struts should either stay attached to one side of the connection upon staging (as they did in KSP 1)  or be auto-deleted.
